title: tsagexastackup.tsc
summary: Brings up the Exascale storage stack in a view (no blockstore, no database). Quick way to stand up Exascale storage only.
details: tsagexastackup.tsc sets up the Exascale storage stack in a view. Running tsagexastackup alone does not start blockstore services or a database. It is used when you want only the Exascale storage stack without blockstore or DB.

examples.description: Bring up Exascale storage stack in a view with default 1 cell and default deployment options.
Bring up storage stack with 3 cells using high mirror mode.
Same stack as above but with EGS deployed in cloudService mode.
Create 3 storage pools for EF, HC, XT and configure the default vault on EF.
3-cell Exascale service deployment with EF and HC storage pools in cloudService mode.

title: xblockini.tsc
summary: Sets up Exascale stack plus blockstore services (BSM/BSW) and creates a block device.
details: xblockini.tsc brings up the Exascale service stack, starts blockstore manager (BSM) and workers (BSW), creates a blockstore volume, attaches it and mounts it. It can also enable tracing and configure EDV / iSCSI / non-EDV modes.

examples.description: Default Exascale stack plus blockstore services with local EDV attached.
Start multiple blockstore services (e.g. 2 BSM + 3 BSW instances).
Start blockstore with high BSW tracing, low/high BSM tracing and medium EDS tracing.

title: xrdbmsini.tsc
summary: Sets up a database on Exascale storage. Accepts tsagexastackup parameters plus DB-specific flags.
details: xrdbmsini.tsc sets up a database on Exascale storage. It accepts all configuration parameters from tsagexastackup for the underlying Exascale stack, and adds DB-specific options like standalone mode, archive log behaviour, and optional blockstore startup.

examples.description: Set up a DB on Exascale storage with one cell, GI, and password files on Exascale vault (archivelog enabled).
DB on Exascale storage with 3 cells and password files on vault.
DB on Exascale with one cell and two storage pools (EF and HC). Voting, OCR and password files on vault across both media types.
DB on Exascale storage deployed in ExaCS (cloud service) mode.
DB without GI; password files are kept on the regular filesystem instead of the vault.
DB on Exascale with EF, HC, XT media types, vault provisioned only on EF in cloud service mode.
Similar to HC+EF case: DB with multiple storage pools, vault spread across both EF and HC.

title: num_cells
summary: Number of cells to set up in the Exascale storage stack.
details: num_cells=<n> specifies how many cells the Exascale stack should use. Default is 1. You can set 3 or 4 cells as long as the Linux VM has enough free memory. When num_cells is 3 or 4, sage_mirror_mode is automatically treated as high.

title: sage_mirror_mode
summary: Mirror mode flag; high mirror mode typically corresponds to 3 cells.
details: sage_mirror_mode is mainly kept for backward compatibility with Exadata tests. A value of high sets up 3 cells. If num_cells=3 or 4 is passed, sage_mirror_mode is implicitly treated as high.

title: egs_deplmode
summary: EGS cluster deployment mode (sharedCloud, privateCloud, onpremises, custom).
details: egs_deplmode=<mode> controls how the EGS cluster is deployed. Valid values are sharedCloud, privateCloud, onpremises, and custom. The default is onpremises unless overridden.

title: privkey / pubkey
summary: Provide key pair to configure the admin user in ERS (mainly for Exascale cloud tests).
details: privkey=<private key path> and pubkey=<public key path> must be passed together. These keys are used to configure the admin user in ERS. This is primarily used for Exascale cloud testing scenarios.

title: media_type
summary: Controls which media types (EF, HC, XT, CF, ALL) are created in the storage pool.
details: media_type can be EF, HC, XT, CF or ALL, optionally comma-separated. EF is Extreme Flash, HC is High Capacity, XT is Extended Storage, CF is Capacity Flash. HC cannot be combined with XT. You can request EF+HC, EF+XT, or ALL (EF, HC, XT). media_type=CF creates Capacity Flash disks in the storage pool.

title: flash_size
summary: Size of FLASH disks created in the setup.
details: flash_size=<n> specifies the FLASH disk size created in the Exascale storage setup.

title: max_rpm
summary: Number of ring partition mirrors configured in the storagepool.
details: max_rpm controls how many ring partition mirrors are configured in the Exascale storage pool.

title: max_cmd_rpm
summary: Number of ring partition mirrors in the container metadata ring.
details: max_cmd_rpm defines how many ring partition mirrors are used in the container metadata ring.

title: delta_sync
summary: Controls whether the Delta Sync feature is enabled (true by default).
details: delta_sync is a boolean flag that controls the Delta Sync feature. It is true by default (feature enabled). To disable Delta Sync for a test, set delta_sync=false.

title: setup5egs
summary: Set up 5 EGS servers in the cluster instead of the default count.
details: setup5egs is a flag that configures the Exascale cluster to use 5 EGS servers.

title: SAVE_CELLSRVSTAT
summary: Periodically save cellsrvstat output for the test.
details: SAVE_CELLSRVSTAT can be set if a test needs to periodically capture cellsrvstat output during execution.

title: diskSizeInMB
summary: Disk size in megabytes used for the setup.
details: diskSizeInMB specifies the size of disks in megabytes for the Exascale storage configuration.

title: EGS_MODE
summary: Config parameter for FARM jobs to choose between EXACS and EXACC.
details: EGS_MODE is a config parameter for FARM jobs. Set EGS_MODE=EXACS or EXACC, pass it via the -config option when submitting an LRG. The LRG runs with the extra parameter you supplied.

examples.description: Run LRG lrgXYZ with ExaCS-style EGS mode.

title: bsm_trace
summary: Controls tracing level for BSM (blockstore manager).
details: bsm_trace sets tracing options for the blockstore manager. It can take two comma-separated values for disk-level and memory-level tracing, each typically l (low), m (medium, default), or h (high).

title: bsw_trace
summary: Controls tracing level for BSW (blockstore worker).
details: bsw_trace sets tracing options for the blockstore worker. It uses the same pattern as bsm_trace (disk-level and memory-level, with values like l, m, h).

title: eds_trace
summary: Controls tracing level for Exascale data services (EDS).
details: eds_trace sets the tracing level for Exascale data services, using the same l/m/h scheme for disk and memory components.

title: multiple_bst
summary: Start multiple blockstore services in the view (e.g. 2 BSM + 3 BSW).
details: When multiple_bst=true, xblockini starts multiple blockstore services such as multiple BSM and BSW instances, allowing multi-instance testing.

title: ledvsetup
summary: Default xblockini mode: sets up a local attached EDV volume.
details: ledvsetup is effectively the default mode for xblockini when run locally. It configures a local attached EDV volume.

title: ledvniscsi
summary: Set up both local EDV and an iSCSI volume.
details: ledvniscsi configures xblockini to set up both a local EDV volume and an iSCSI volume in the same environment.

title: edvsetup
summary: Set up cluster and node EDV, using a non-oracle user to run edvsrv.
details: edvsetup configures a cluster and node-level EDV and uses a non-oracle user to run the edvsrv process.

title: iscsi
summary: Enable iSCSI mode with no EDV configured.
details: iscsi tells xblockini to set up iSCSI mode only. No EDV is configured when this flag is used. Exascale stack plus blockstore run on iSCSI-based volumes.

title: noniscsi
summary: Non-iSCSI mode with no EDV; BSW runs with cellcli.
details: noniscsi selects non-iSCSI mode with no EDV. In this mode only, BSW runs with cellcli.

title: standalone
summary: Skip GI setup; password files live on the regular filesystem.
details: standalone is an xrdbmsini flag that skips GI setup. Voting and password files are stored on the regular filesystem instead of Exascale vault.

title: setup_blockstore
summary: Start BSW and BSM along with the database setup.
details: setup_blockstore=true in xrdbmsini will start blockstore worker (BSW) and manager (BSM) along with the DB setup. By default, blockstore services are not started in a DB-only Exascale setup.

title: media_type_vault
summary: Controls which media type the Exascale vault uses (e.g. EF).
details: media_type_vault defines which media type the vault is provisioned on. For example, media_type_vault=EF means the vault uses EF even if EF, HC and XT pools are present.

title: egsdepl_mode
summary: Database-side spelling of EGS deployment mode (e.g. cloudService).
details: egsdepl_mode on xrdbmsini is the DB-side spelling used to deploy EGS, for example egsdepl_mode=cloudService for ExaCS-style deployments.

title: multisp
summary: Enable multiple storage pools for the DB (e.g. EF and HC).
details: multisp=true configures the DB on Exascale storage using multiple underlying storage pools (for example EF and HC), similar to the HC+EF case described in the examples.
